about: Principal-level Frontend Engineer with 20+ years of experience designing, modernizing, and scaling enterprise web platforms. Served as the highest-level frontend technical leader at ACS Technologies, defining architectural standards across 10+ engineering teams and 8+ enterprise applications. Deep expertise in Vue.js, TypeScript, design systems, and frontend platform engineering. Hands-on individual contributor focused on scalable systems, modernization initiatives, cross-team technical leadership, and long-term maintainability.

description: Served as highest-level frontend technical authority across 10+ engineering teams and 8+ enterprise SaaS products, establishing UI architecture standards influencing 30+ engineers organization-wide.
Established shared component strategy and design system foundations adopted across 8+ products, preventing redundant UI implementations and significantly improving cross-product consistency.
Architected a global, framework-agnostic Web Components platform, enabling reusable functionality across multiple technical stacks (Vue, Angular, React) and eliminating duplicated feature builds.

Led organization-wide modernization initiatives, including Vue 2 → Vue 3 migration, delivering reusable upgrade frameworks that allowed teams to modernize in parallel without disrupting active release cycles.
Defined and executed multi-year frontend platform roadmap, aligning modernization with active release cycles and preventing disruption across 8+ revenue-generating products.
Engineered reusable AI-powered components leveraging OpenAI APIs and introduced AI-assisted development workflows (Cursor, Cody, Amp) to accelerate delivery and improve architectural consistency.
Partnered cross-functionally to mitigate architectural risk, reduce regression exposure during modernization, and unblock delivery bottlenecks across product teams.
Mentored senior engineers while remaining hands-on in architectural reference implementations and high-impact code paths.
Led architectural redesign of flagship church management platform, delivering structural, component, and styling overhaul that improved maintainability and accelerated feature development.
Spearheaded migration of extensive legacy jQuery plugin ecosystem to Vue-based component architecture, reducing technical debt and lowering regression risk during ongoing feature delivery.
Served as company-wide escalation point for complex frontend architectural challenges, resolving high-impact technical blockers affecting multiple teams.
Provided architectural guidance and structured technical training that reduced recurring frontend defects and improved cross-team implementation consistency.
Led company-wide Frontend Community of Practice supporting 30+ engineers, aligning standards and reducing architectural divergence across product teams.
Established frontend governance model including shared patterns, decoupled asset pipelines, and code review guardrails, improving long-term maintainability and reducing defect risk.

Drove early modernization initiatives transitioning legacy UI systems toward reactive component-based architectures, improving development velocity and laying groundwork for enterprise-wide Vue adoption.
Contributed to senior-level hiring and mentoring efforts, strengthening overall frontend technical capability across the organization.
Acted as frontend architectural lead, defining technical direction and mentoring junior developers to improve implementation consistency and code quality.
Led creation and documentation of shared frontend patterns and components, enabling cross-team adoption and reducing duplicated implementation effort.
Built and maintained internal “app kit” developer platform with documentation, code snippets, and live demos, reducing onboarding time and decreasing reliance on one-on-one support.
Spearheaded early adoption of Vue.js, initiating transition from jQuery-based plugins to reactive component architecture and improving long-term maintainability.

education.degree: B.S. in Computer Science, Minor in Applied Mathematics

projects.name: Verse of the Day
projects.description: Built an app to display a different Bible verse on a different background photo each day. Includes a Cloudflare worker and a Node.js Web Push service to handle subscriptions and daily push notifications.

projects.description: Built a resume generator with Vite, Vue 3, Puppeteer, and LESS, and used it to generate my resume.
